newsitem.title: ARGENTINA: Buenos Aires power distribution sale gets $969 mln.
newsitem.headline: Buenos Aires power distribution sale gets $969 mln.

text.p: The government of Buenos Aires Province said Monday two groups, AESEBA SA and Inversora Electrica de Buenos Aires SA, had won the bidding for the distribution business of provincial power firm Eseba.
It said the winning bids valued the distribution business of Empresa Social de Energia de Buenos Aires (Eseba) at $969 million in total.
The sale of electricity distribution for an area of 1.38 million users in Argentina's most populous province had been divided up into three regions -- north, south and Atlantic.
AESEBA, whose full name is AESEBA-CEA Operating Argentina SA, won both the north and south bids with a joint offer of $565 million.
Inversora Electrica, a consortium made up of Argentina's Camuzzi SA, Loma Negra and United Utilities, won the Atlantic area with a $404 million bid.
The provincial government said in a statement that the distribution business of Eseba has annual sales of $660 million.
Provincial Gov. Eduardo Duhalde had been aiming to raise $1.0 billion from the sale.
The value of bids for the sell-off of Eseba's generating business will be revealed on April 28.
